note:
收购条款没有披露。福特投注，三岁旧金山创业公司开发的软件将在2030年到2030年收费的收入中捕获超过10亿美元的收入。福特专业人士将超越充电之外的财务雄心。业务部门表示，预计将在2019年2025亿美元起，2025年以上的硬件和邻近和新服务收入为450亿美元。
 Electivihi以及其30人团队将折叠到新铸造的Ford Pro业务部门，该企业专注于为其电力运输范围和F-150 Lightning Pro Pickup卡车提供服务。福特将于今年晚些时候向客户发运电子交通。 F-150 Lightning Pro是全电闪电拾取卡车的商业变体，预计将在2022年来到市场。
  “作为商业客户将电动汽车添加到船队中，他们希望仓库收费选择，以确保它们能够加入并准备每天上班，”福特Pro Ceo Ted Carmis说。 “通过福特专业电动汽车和服务组合中的Electriphi现有的先进技术IP，我们将提升商业客户的经验，并成为舰队仓库充电的单一来源解决方案。”
 Electiphi于2018年推出，当时即将到来的国家和联邦授权将推动重型车辆和中型商业舰队对电气化，联合创始人兼首席执行官Muffi Ghadiali在最近的面试中告诉TechCrunch。该公司专注于部署美国和国际上的商业电动汽车的部分，该列表包括校车和运输公交车。
 “如果你想想在未来10年里发生的事情 - 这是对能源和软件的移动性的大规模转变，”Ghadiali说。 “赌注令人难以置信的高，时间不多了。”他注意到舰队运营商对即将到来的授权，这将在十年结束时搬到零排放车辆。 “在10年内翻过整个舰队，你现在必须开始;他们要去，“我必须确保我的舰队操作不会跳过心跳，而这种过渡正在发生。＆＃39;”
 福特首次接近电埃斯蒂希在2021年初。在与自动论坛交易之前，启动只筹集了420万美元的估值约为1100万美元。
 虽然福特的重点是为其E-Transit和Lightning Pro构建软件，但它可能还将继续为Extriphi的客户群提供服务。 
“有趣的是，正如事实证明，底层福特平台在许多不同的车型以及校车上使用，”Ghadiali说。 “所以很难说我们仍然不会进入哪些部分，因为他们知道他们与我们所做的事情非常相关。 当然，我们的重点将是福特在明年将发货的大量。“
note_en:
Terms of the acquisition weren’t disclosed. Ford is betting that the software developed by the three-year-old San Francisco startup will help it capture more than $1 billion in revenue just from charging by 2030. Ford Pro has financial ambitions beyond charging. The business unit said it expects to generate $45 billion in revenue from hardware and adjacent and new services by 2025 — up from $27 billion in 2019.
 Electriphi, along with its 30-person team, will be folded into the newly minted Ford Pro business unit, which is focused on providing services to commercial customers of its electric Transit van and F-150 Lightning Pro pickup truck. Ford will start shipping E-Transit to customers later this year. The F-150 Lightning Pro, a commercial variant of the all-electric Lightning pickup truck, is expected to come to market in spring 2022.
  “As commercial customers add electric vehicles to their fleets, they want depot charging options to make sure they’re powered up and ready to go to work every day,” said Ford Pro CEO Ted Cannis. “With Electriphi’s existing advanced technology IP in the Ford Pro electric vehicles and services portfolio, we will enhance the experience for commercial customers and be a single-source solution for fleet-depot charging.”
 Electriphi launched in 2018 when it became obvious that upcoming state and federal mandates would drive heavy duty vehicles and mid-sized commercial fleets towards electrification, co-founder and CEO Muffi Ghadiali told TechCrunch in a recent interview. The company has focused on segments deploying commercial electric vehicles in the U.S. and internationally, a list that includes school buses and transit buses.
 “If you just think about what’s going to happen in the next 10 years — it’s a massive transformation in mobility for energy and software,”  Ghadiali said. “The stakes are incredibly high and time is running out.” He noted fleet operators are nervous about that upcoming mandates that will require moving to zero-emissions vehicles by the end of the decade. “To turn over your entire fleet in 10 years, you have to start now; they’re going, ‘I have to make sure that my fleet operations don’t skip a heartbeat, while this transition is happening.'”
 Ford first approached Electriphi in early 2021. The startup had raised just $4.2 million at a valuation of about $11 million prior to the deal with autoomaker.
 While Ford’s focus is building out the software for its E-Transit and Lightning Pro, it is possible that it will also continue to serve Electriphi’s customer base.
 “Interestingly, as it turns out, the underlying Ford platform is used across many different vehicle types as well as school buses,” Ghadiali said. “So it’s hard to say which segments we won’t still be in because they are you know they are very relevant to what we do. Of course, our focus will be the large volume that the Ford is going to ship in the next year.”
title: 福特收购Electivehi，因为它准备Woo EV舰队客户
title_en: Ford acquires Electriphi as it prepares to woo EV fleet customers

note:
JPMORGAN CHASE＆amp;公司同意购买数字财富经理Nutmeg储蓄和投资有限公司，是推动在U.K的零售银行业务的一部分。
  肉豆蔻，成立于2012年，拥有超过140,000多名客户和35亿英镑的管理，相当于50亿美元。收购的价格未披露，但熟悉该交易的人表示约为10亿美元。
  JPMORGAN在1月份表示，它将在U.K中发起一个新的数字银行。首次在那里提供消费银行服务。被称为Chase，它目前正在在今年晚些时候在公开推出之前与JPMORGAN员工在内部进行测试。
  银行表示，肉豆蔻的储蓄和投资产品不会通过零售银行项目提供。
      JPMORGAN正在U.K.监管机构进入拥挤的数字银行市场。监督者鼓励新的初创公司，包括Starling Bank Ltd.和Monzo Bank Ltd.，在最后的全球金融危机之后提高竞争。这些所谓的挑战银行迫使传统贷方改善其数码产品，但努力赚取利润。
  据熟悉这种情况，去年去年去年被认为是由Anne Boden成立的椋鸟银行。
  JPMORGAN先前试图在美国城市和市场推出数字银行，在那里它没有追逐分支机构，而是在慢拾取后，于2019年6月关闭了芬恩的产品。银行管理人员表示，他们从该计划中学到了教训，包括追逐品牌的共鸣比新名称更好。 
Nutmeg旨在通过互联网将财富管理更加访问，该公司的首席执行官在一份声明中表示。 肉豆蔻被选为名称，因为香料，如财富和投资服务，曾经罕见，昂贵，但现在广泛可用。  与其他投资站点一样，它销售获得资金，ETF和养老金。 Nutmeg上诉投资新手，避免术语，提供工具和Q＆amp;关于金融世界的INS和出局。  本公司2019年的收入增长了29％至上一年的930万英镑，其损失增加了15％〜2120万英镑。 其股东将在该交易中买出来，包括高盛集团和施罗德斯·普尔（Schroders Plc）。  出现在2021年6月18日，打印版作为＆＃39; jpmorgan在U.K. Digital Push中购买肉豆蔻。＆＃39;
note_en:
JPMorgan Chase   & Co. agreed to buy digital wealth manager Nutmeg Saving and Investment Ltd., part of a push to establish a retail banking presence in the U.K.
  Nutmeg, founded in 2012, has more than 140,000 customers and £3.5 billion under management, the equivalent of around $5 billion. A price for the acquisition wasn’t disclosed but people familiar with the transaction said it was about $1 billion.
  JPMorgan said in January it would  launch a new digital bank in the U.K., offering consumer banking services there for the first time. Called Chase, it is currently being tested internally with JPMorgan employees ahead of a public launch later this year.
  Nutmeg’s savings and investment products won’t initially be offered through the retail banking project, the bank said.
      JPMorgan is entering a crowded digital banking marketplace in the U.K. Regulators encouraged new startups, including Starling Bank Ltd. and Monzo Bank Ltd., to boost competition in the wake of the last global financial crisis. These so-called challenger banks have forced traditional lenders to improve their digital offerings but have struggled to earn profits.
  JPMorgan last year considered making a bid for Starling Bank, founded by Anne Boden in 2014, according to people familiar with the situation.
  JPMorgan previously tried to launch a digital bank in U.S. cities and markets where it didn’t have Chase branches, but closed the product, called Finn, in June 2019 after slow pickup. Bank executives have said they learned lessons from that program, including that the Chase brand resonated better than a new name.
  Nutmeg aims to make wealth management more accessible through the internet, Neil Alexander, the company’s chief executive, said in a statement. Nutmeg was chosen as a name because the spice, like wealth and investment services, was once rare and costly but is now widely available.
  Like other investment sites, it sells access to funds, ETFs and pensions. Nutmeg appeals to investment novices, avoids jargon and provides tools and Q&As about the ins and outs of the finance world.
  The company’s revenue grew 29% in 2019 to £9.3 million from the previous year, and its loss increased 15% to £21.2 million. Its shareholders, who will be bought out in the deal, include  Goldman Sachs Group  and  Schroders PLC, the U.K. asset manager.
  Appeared in the June 18, 2021, print edition as 'JPMorgan Buys Nutmeg in U.K. Digital Push.'
title: JPMORGAN购买英国的数字财富经理肉豆蔻，拥有140k +客户，管理资产约为5亿美元; 消息人士称交易值得1亿美元
title_en: JPMorgan buys UK-based digital wealth manager Nutmeg, which has 140K+ customers and about $5B in assets under management; sources say deal is worth about $1B

note:
新数据表明，除非广告商仔细注意他们的排除列表，否则在线上广告可以在网上旁边出现广告。
        根据研究人员Lia Bozarth和Ceren Budak在密歇根大学信息学院的新研究，谷歌在“假”新闻网站上有48％的广告交通。
 研究人员分析了题为“虚假，误导，点击条款的名单上的网站的广告，由Melissa Zimdars创建的Melissa Zimdars创建的”虚假，误导，点击巴 -  y和/或讽刺“学者，Merrimack College学士学位。
 Bozarth和Budak的研究表明，尽管谷歌这样的大玩家从这些骗局新闻网站上获得了广告的无关nounce收入，但它们仍然“负责在假冒和低质量的新闻网站上提供大量广告。”
 该研究“补充说，旨在减少误导和欺骗的市场激励的干预可能有效，”TechPolicy贾斯汀亨德里克斯写道。
 此外，“研究人员发现，”十大可信广告服务器“，如锁具多群岛和卖方，占伪造的66.7％，占低质量广告交通的55.6％，”瑞安巴利克斯营销酿造。
 为什么我们关心。品牌安全对过去几年的广告商及其客户来说是真正关注的。随着更多搜索营销人员在旁边找到他们的广告内容，这是旁边的思想之上，它是旁边的负面，假的，彻头彻尾的垃圾场所。谷歌自己的2020年的公告安全报告专注于敏感性“以品牌”控制在他们的广告所显示的地方，因为仇恨言论增加，“我们今年早些时候写道。但是，这种新数据表明，除非广告商仔细注意他们的排除列表，否则他们可能会在在线假新闻和误导内容旁边出现。 
Carolyn Lyden是搜索引擎土地和SMX的搜索内容主任。 在SEO，内容营销，本地搜索和分析的专业知识，她侧重于制作营销人员＆＃39; 乔布斯更轻松的重要新闻和教育内容。
note_en:
New data indicates that unless advertisers are paying careful attention to their exclusion lists, there's a chance that ads could be showing up next to fake news online.
        Google serves 48% of all ad traffic on “fake” news sites according to a  new study from researchers Lia Bozarth and Ceren Budak at the University of Michigan School of Information.
 The researchers analyzed the advertising on sites from a list entitled “False, Misleading, Clickbait-y, and/or Satirical ‘News’ Sources” created by Melissa Zimdars, critical media studies scholar at Merrimack College.
 The research from Bozarth and Budak states that, even though big players like Google receive inconsequential revenues from advertising on these scam news websites, they are still “responsible for delivering a substantial fraction of ads on fake and low-quality news sites.”
 The study “adds to the case that interventions aimed at reducing the market incentives for mis- and disinformation can be effective,”  wrote Justin Hendrix for TechPolicy.
 Additionally, “the researchers found that the ‘top-10 credible ad servers,’ like Lockerdome and Outbrain, make up 66.7% of fake and 55.6% of low-quality ad traffic,”  said Ryan Barwick for Marketing Brew.
 Why we care.  Brand safety has been a real concern for advertisers and their clients for the last few years. It’s been top of mind as more search marketers are finding their ad content served up next to negative, fake, and downright spammy sites. Google’s own 2020 Ad Safety Report focused on sensitivity “to brands’ need for control over where their ads displayed as there were increases in hate speech and calls to violence online,”  we wrote earlier this year. But this new data indicates that unless advertisers are paying careful attention to their  exclusion lists, there’s a chance that they could be showing up next to fake news and misleading content online.
       Carolyn Lyden serves as the Director of Search Content for Search Engine Land and SMX. With expertise in SEO, content marketing, local search, and analytics, she focuses on making marketers' jobs easier with important news and educational content.
title: 新研究显示谷歌在假新闻网站上近一半的广告
title_en: New research shows Google serves almost half of all ads on fake news sites

note_en: Imgur: The magic of the Internet
title: HBO：“此模板仅通过集成测试使用。”
title_en: HBO: “This template is used by integration tests only.”

note:
7月交付期货周二周二以1,009.90美元的价格为每千辆，下降41％，从5月初达到1,711.20美元。期货在过去的16个交易日中有14个。
  现金木材价格也崩溃。定价服务随机长度表示，其框架综合指数追踪现场销售额，其最大的每周下降122至1,324美元。在5月的第一周索引上涨124美元后，下跌六周是六周，最重要的是。随机长度描述了一种混沌溃败，其中锯木厂经理努力为客户提供价格报价。星期二表示，其指数下降了114美元，达到1,210美元。
  经济学家和投资者想知道木材产品的天空高价格是否会使住房市场蓬勃发展。建筑商在安装铆钉之前提高了房价，许多人停止卖房，以免误导成本并畅销。木材成为通货膨胀辩论的核心：逃任通货膨胀的时期是否正在进行或高价格是暂时的冲击，因为经济从锁定进一步移动时会放松。
    迅速下降表明了一个爆发的泡沫，问题是低木材价格将如何下降。即使在翻滚后，木材期货仍然近三倍于一年中这个典型的典型。木材生产商和贸易商预计由于房地产市场强劲，价格将保持相对较高，但供应瓶颈和疯狂的购买，以为经济重新开放和向旧的历史高级倍增的倍数送达。
      在跑步期间，墙上的囤积者，零售商和其他人在施工赛季的施工赛期间被低抵押贷款率和联邦刺激款项预防，占据了物质。
  “每个人都购买的比他们所需要的更多，”迈克·威尔纽斯基说，这是在线市场材料Xchange的前木材交易商和首席执行官。 “有这种恐惧缺乏可用性。”
  现在市场正在被Wisnefski先生呼叫影子库存作为通常是大买家的业务的淹没，例如家庭建筑商和预制桁架的公司，从他们自己的库存中卖出屋顶和地板。 
木材生产商表示，随着家庭建设者试图抹去国家的住房赤字，价格应该保持相对较高。抵押贷款金融公司Freddie Mac于4月份估计，美国约有380万房屋害羞的满足需求，主要致力于2008年住房崩溃后缺乏建设。
  “我认为我不需要1000美元的木材价格是新的正常新的正常，”Lumber Producer Weyerhaeuser Wy -0.99％的首席​​执行官Devin Streadfish Wy -0.99％在上周在会议上告诉投资者。 “但是说，当你想到所以在未来三个，五个，10年内，我们将要在美国那里建造的住房数量，这只是对木制品的大量需求。”
  在同一次会议上，来自木材生产商Potlatchdeltic PCH -0.40％的高管表示，他们希望木材在700美元至下一年的范围内交易。这仍然超过了大流行前639美元的历史记录，依据他们对不列颠哥伦比亚省米尔斯的价格的估计，甚至需要打破北美最昂贵的日志。他们说，下面的价格可以提示加拿大的磨坊，以拨回产出或关闭，这最终会强迫价格更高，以满足需求。
    股市仍在假设较低的木材价格。 BMO Capital Markets的分析人士最近计算出三个加拿大公司已成为南方南部最大的锯片的公司的股价已在明年的期望中定价为447美元。这将比正常贵，但更多符合历史价格。
  这些公司 -  IFP-3.35％，CANFOR CFPZF -2.97％和West Fraser Timber WFG -3.18％ - 与美国竞争对手Weyerhaeuser和Potlatchdeltic有缺口创业盈利，因为去年夏天升高了磨坊以满足意外的需求。
  Sawmill业主拥有大流行的一些最佳表现股票，尽管所有五个木材生产商在过去一个月内至少有9.5％。
  上季度森林产品高管的一系列股票销售表明，这些公司顶部的人认为，历史执行股票销售和采购的研究总监Ben Silverman表示，那些在后卫中。 
对您家庭建筑或装修项目的木材价格有什么影响？加入下面的对话。
  据Insiderscore表示，韦伊赫队的高管在2016年第三季度自2016年第三季度以来的价值为1460万美元的公司股票。 Potlatchdeltic高管在此期间销售了1210万美元，自Insiderscore于2003年开始跟踪。Timberland所有者Rayonier Ryn -0.99％亦披露了十多个十多年的内部人的最重的销售。 Rayonier不拥有任何锯木厂，而是拥有新西兰的Timberland和太平洋西北地区，日志价格与木材的日志一起上升。 Weyerhaeuser和Rayonier的发言人拒绝发表评论。 Potlatchdeltic的代表没有回应评论的要求。
  “这种销售水平只是不寻常的，并且在像这样的同行之间的这种类型的对齐是不寻常的，”Silverman先生说。 “它在本集团中显示了关于他们如何考虑其股票价格的达成共识。”
  出现在2021年6月16日，印刷版作为＆＃39;木材价格下沉作为囤积者卸载。＆＃39;
note_en:
Futures for July delivery ended Tuesday at $1,009.90 per thousand board feet, down 41% from the record of $1,711.20 reached in early May. Futures have declined 14 of the past 16 trading days.
  Cash lumber prices are also crashing. Pricing service Random Lengths said Friday that its framing composite index, which tracks on-the-spot sales, dropped $122 to $1,324, its biggest ever weekly decline. The pullback came just six weeks after the index rose $124 during the first week of May, its most on record. Random Lengths described a chaotic rout in which sawmill managers struggled to provide customers with price quotes. It said late Tuesday that its index had dropped another $114, to $1,210.
  Economists and investors have wondered if sky-high prices for wood products would doom  the booming housing market. Builders raised home prices and many stopped selling houses before the studs were installed, lest they misjudge costs and sell too cheaply. Lumber became central to  the inflation debate: whether a period of runaway inflation was afoot or high prices were temporary shocks that would ease as the economy moved further from lockdown.
    The rapid decline suggests a bubble that has burst and the question is how low lumber prices will fall. Even after tumbling, lumber futures remain nearly three times what is typical for this time of year. Lumber producers and traders expect that prices will remain relatively high due to the strong housing market, but that the supply bottlenecks and frenzied buying that characterized the economy’s reopening and sent prices to multiples of the old all-time highs are winding down.
      During the run-up, wood was hoarded by builders, retailers and others worried about running out of material during a construction season set into overdrive by low mortgage rates and federal stimulus payments.
  “Everyone was buying more than they needed,” said Mike Wisnefski, a former lumber trader and chief executive of online marketplace MaterialsXchange. “There was this fear of lack of availability.”
  Now the market is being flooded by what Mr. Wisnefski calls shadow inventory as businesses that are normally big buyers, such as home builders and companies that prefabricate the trusses that hold up roofs and floors, sell from their own stockpiles.
    Lumber producers say that prices should remain relatively high as home builders try to erase the country’s deficit of housing. Mortgage-finance firm Freddie Mac estimated in April that the U.S.  is about 3.8 million houses shy of meeting demand, thanks largely to the lack of construction following the 2008 housing crash.
  “I don’t think $1,000 lumber prices are the new normal,” Devin Stockfish, chief executive of lumber producer  Weyerhaeuser    WY  -0.99%  , told investors at a conference last week. “But that being said, when you think about the amount of housing that we’re going to have to build in the U.S. over the next three, five, 10 years, that’s just a significant amount of demand for wood products.”
  At the same conference, executives from lumber producer  PotlatchDeltic    PCH  -0.40%  said they expect lumber to trade in a range of $700 to $800 through next year. That is still more than the pre-pandemic record of $639 and is based on their estimation of the price that mills in British Columbia need to break even sawing North America’s most-expensive logs. Prices below that could prompt mills in Canada to dial back output or shut down, which would eventually force prices higher to meet demand, they said.
    The stock market is assuming even lower lumber prices ahead. Analysts with BMO Capital Markets recently calculated that the share prices of three Canadian firms that have become  the biggest sawyers in the southern pinelands have priced in expectations of $447 lumber next year. That would be a little more expensive than normal, but more in line with historical prices.
  Those firms—  Interfor    IFP  -3.35%  ,  Canfor    CFPZF  -2.97%  and  West Fraser Timber    WFG  -3.18%  —along with U.S. rivals Weyerhaeuser and PotlatchDeltic  have notched record profits since ramping up mills to meet an  unexpected rush of demand last summer.
  Sawmill owners have had some of the best performing stocks of the pandemic, though all five lumber producers are down at least 9.5% over the past month.
  A flurry of stock sales by forest-products executives last quarter suggests that those at the top of these firms believe peak lumber is in the rearview, said Ben Silverman, director of research at InsiderScore, which tracks executive stock sales and purchases.
  What impact has the price of lumber had on your home construction or renovation project? Join the conversation below.
  Executives at Weyerhaeuser sold $14.6 million worth of company shares last quarter, the most since the third quarter of 2016, according to InsiderScore. PotlatchDeltic executives sold $12.1 million during that time, the most since InsiderScore began keeping track in 2003. Timberland owner  Rayonier    RYN  -0.99%  also disclosed the heaviest selling by insiders in more than a decade. Rayonier doesn’t own any sawmills but holds timberland in New Zealand and the Pacific Northwest, where log prices have risen along with those of lumber. Spokesmen for Weyerhaeuser and Rayonier declined to comment. Representatives for PotlatchDeltic didn’t respond to requests for comment.
  “This level of selling is simply unusual and to have this type of alignment among peers like this is unusual,” Mr. Silverman said. “It shows a consensus within the group about how they are thinking about their stock prices.”
  Appeared in the June 16, 2021, print edition as 'Lumber Prices Sink As Hoarders Unload.'
title: 木材价格迅速下降，将囤积者转向卖家
title_en: Lumber Prices Are Falling Fast, Turning Hoarders into Sellers
